Package cmpt355.project.codegen

Class Helper

java.lang.Object
cmpt355.project.codegen.Helper
public final class Helper
extends Object
A class that provides helpful shortcuts for common operations in JVM assembly. Each public static method takes a CompileContext parameter and adds the appropriate code to it.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • convertTypes

      public static void convertTypes​(CompileContext context, PrimitiveType from, PrimitiveType to)
      Converts between two primitive types using the instructions Opcode.i2l, Opcode.f2i, and friends. If no conversion need be done (e.g. the types are the same, or they are represented the same on the JVM) no code is added. For example, Helper.convertTypes(context, PrimitiveType.DOUBLE, PrimitiveType.LONG) will add an Opcode.d2l instruction to context. Helper.convertTypes(context, PrimitiveType.SHORT, PrimitiveType.INT) will add no code (since short and int values are represented the same on the JVM stack).
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      from - the primitive type to convert from
      to - the primitive type to convert to

    • pop

      public static void pop​(CompileContext context, DataType type)
      Adds the appropriate pop instruction to context according to type.
      • If type is DataType.VOID, does nothing;
      • if type is a category 2 type (PrimitiveType.LONG or PrimitiveType.DOUBLE), adds a Opcode.pop2 instruction;
      • otherwise, type is a category 1 type, so a Opcode.pop is added.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      type - the data type of the value to pop

    • dup

      public static void dup​(CompileContext context, DataType type)
      Adds the appropriate dup instruction to context according to type.
      • If type is a category 2 type (PrimitiveType.LONG or PrimitiveType.DOUBLE), adds a Opcode.dup2 instruction;
      • otherwise, type is a category 1 type, so a Opcode.dup is added.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      type - the data type of the value to duplicate

    • dup_x1

      public static void dup_x1​(CompileContext context, DataType type)
      Adds the appropriate dup_x1 instruction to context according to type.
      • If type is a category 2 type (PrimitiveType.LONG or PrimitiveType.DOUBLE), adds a Opcode.dup2_x1 instruction;
      • otherwise, type is a category 1 type, so a Opcode.dup_x1 is added.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      type - the data type of the value to duplicate

    • dup_x2

      public static void dup_x2​(CompileContext context, DataType type)
      Adds the appropriate dup_x2 instruction to context according to type.
      • If type is a category 2 type (PrimitiveType.LONG or PrimitiveType.DOUBLE), adds a Opcode.dup2_x2 instruction;
      • otherwise, type is a category 1 type, so a Opcode.dup_x2 is added.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      type - the data type of the value to duplicate

    • istore

      public static void istore​(CompileContext context, int varIndex)
      Adds the appropriate istore instruction to context according to the variable index.
      • If varIndex is 0, 1, 2, or 3, adds an Opcode.istore_0...Opcode.istore_3 instruction;
      • otherwise adds an Opcode.istore instruction.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      varIndex - the index of the variable in the local variable array

    • lstore

      public static void lstore​(CompileContext context, int varIndex)
      Adds the appropriate lstore instruction to context according to the variable index.
      • If varIndex is 0, 1, 2, or 3, adds an Opcode.lstore_0...Opcode.lstore_3 instruction;
      • otherwise adds an Opcode.lstore instruction.
      Parameters:
      context - the context to add code to
      varIndex - the index of the variable in the local variable array

    • fstore

      public static void fstore​(CompileContext context, int varIndex)

      • If varIndex is 0, 1, 2, or 3, adds an Opcode.fstore_0...Opcode.fstore_3 instruction;
      • otherwise adds an Opcode.fstore instruction.
      Parameters:

      varIndex - the index of the variable in the local variable array
